creator: yoshida@cc.kagu.tus.ac.jp
text:
Hello, I have an trouble. Please help me. I'm using Apache httpd server 1.3.24, on AIX 4.3.3 and Solaris 8. In this server, /usr/local/apache/cgi-bin directory has limitation access outside of xxx.xxx.xxx subnet, using .htaccess file. There are configured the following: an extract from /usr/local/apche/conf/access.conf: AllowOverride Limit SetHandler cgi-script Options -Indexes FollowSymLinks ExecCGI IncludesNOEXEC order deny,allow allow from all .htaccess file in /usr/local/apche/cgi-bin/ directory: order deny,allow deny from all allow from xxx.xxx.xxx To this server, I'm tried http access as follows in outside host of xxx.xxx.xxx subnet: % telnet yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy 80 Trying... Connected to yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy. Escape character is '^]'. GET /cgi-bin/printenv 403 Forbidden

Forbidden

You don't have permission to access /cgi-bin/printenv on this server.

Apache/1.3.24 Server at yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy Port 80
Connection closed. % This access is rightful. But, % telnet yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy 80 Trying... Connected to yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy. Escape character is '^]'. get /cgi-bin/printenv LANG="ja" : Connection closed. % this access is wrong. Using lower-case "GET" METHOD, .htaccess limitation will be disabled. This situation only occur in the following condition: - In Apache configuration file, SetHandler Directive is configured to cgi-script or type-map, or ScriptAlias Directive is configured. - In the above Directory or Location, Using .htaccess limitation is active. If I have miss configuration, please tell me a means of solving. Otherwise, I hope Apache Server will be modified. Thanks.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
User configuration question - not a bug.  [Hint: see the Override directory syntax.]

As repeatedly stated, this database is for tracking bugs in ASF projects only,
not for configuration problems.

And also, method names ARE case sensitive, and you haven't restricted "get".
Please see the docs for <Limit> to find out why you almost never want to
use it.
